notes.text:
Several industrial products are affected by a vulnerability that could allow remote attackers to conduct a denial of service attack by sending specially crafted packets to port 161/udp (SNMP).

Siemens has released new versions for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens is preparing further fix versions and recommends specific countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: Siemens Security Advisories are subject to the terms and conditions contained in Siemens' underlying license terms or other applicable agreements previously agreed to with Siemens (hereinafter "License Terms"). To the extent applicable to information, software or documentation made available in or through a Siemens Security Advisory, the Terms of Use of Siemens' Global Website (https://www.siemens.com/terms_of_use, hereinafter "Terms of Use"), in particular Sections 8-10 of the Terms of Use, shall apply additionally. In case of conflicts, the License Terms shall prevail over the Terms of Use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

revision_history.summary: Publication Date
Changed affected products: V2.0 and newer of SIMATIC S7-1500 and V2.0 and newer of SIMATIC S7-1500 Software Controller are not affected. Added update information for SIMATIC S7-400 H V6
New advisory format, added update information for SINAMICS V90 w. PN, SINAMICS S120 and SINAMICS S110 w. PN
Added update for S7-400 V7 and SIMATIC ET 200MP IM155-5 PN BA

Added update for SIMATIC ET 200MP IM155-5 PN ST, SIMOTION P V4.4 and V4.5, and Development/Evaluation Kits for PROFINET IO DK Standard Ethernet Controller and EK-ERTEC 200, Corrected patch link for SIMOTION D
Added update information for V4.8 of SINAMICS G130, G150, S120 and S150
Added update information for V4.7 of SINAMICS G130, G150, S120 and S150
Added update for SINAMICS DCP w. PN and SINAMICS DCM w. PN
Added update for SIMATIC S7-1200 CPU
Updated solution for SINAMICS S120, added solution for PN/PN Coupler, SIMATIC ET200 SP, SIMATIC S7-400 V8, SIMOCODE pro V PROFINET
Updated solution for SIMATIC ET 200MP IM155-5 PN HF
Updated solution for SIMATIC S7-300
Updated solution for SIMATIC ET 200SP IM155-6 PN HA
Update for SINUMERIK 840D sl
Renamed SIMATIC WinAC RTX 2010 incl. F to SIMATIC WinAC RTX (F) 2010 and added update information for SIMATIC WinAC RTX (F) 2010
SIPLUS devices now explicitly mentioned in the list of affected products
Mention that SIMATIC S7-400 CPU family below V6 is vulnerable
Added SIMATIC TDC CP51M1 and CPU555 to the list of affected products
Added SIMATIC ET200ecoPN product variants (MLFB IDs) that are not affected
Added ecoPN model (6ES7148-6JG00-0BB0) as not affected
Updated solution for SIMATIC ET200SP IM155-6 PN HS
Clarified affected ET200ecoPN models
Clarified that no remediation is planned for ET200 devices
Listed affected products individually instead of product families (e.g., for SIMATIC ET 200AL/MP/SP/pro IM families); added affected SIPLUS devices (e.g., SIPLUS ET 200xx IM)

notes.text: Specially crafted packets sent to port 161/udp could cause a denial of service condition. The affected devices must be restarted manually.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Disable  SNMP  if  this  is  supported  by  the  product  (refer  to  the  product documentation). Disabling SNMP fully mitigates the vulnerability.
Protect network access to port 161/udp of affected devices.
